text: A referendum on the new constitution or organic law of Spain was held in Spanish Sahara on 14 December 1966 as part of the wider Spanish referendum.Sternberger, D, Vogel, B, Nohlen, D & Landfried, K (1978) Die Wahl der Parlamente: Band II: Afrika, Zweiter Halbband, p1738 The Organic Law of the State () was approved by 94.6% of voters in Spanish Sahara and 98.1% of voters overall. ==Results== {| class="wikitable" style=text-align:right |+Results to the question: "Do you approve of the Organic Law of the State Bill?" |- !Choice !Votes !% |- |align=left|For|| ||94.6 |- |align=left|Against|| ||5.4 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||— |- |align=left|Total|| ||100 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||18,802||94.2 |- |align=left colspan=3|Source: Sternberger et al. |} ==References== Category:1966 referendums Category:1966 in Spanish Sahara Category:Referendums in Western Sahara Category:Referendums in Spain
title: 1966 Spanish organic law referendum in Spanish Sahara
